Table Contest 2022 - Amtrak

geospatial
reactable
Published

October 3, 2022

https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Recursive

https://data-usdot.opendata.arcgis.com/datasets/usdot::amtrak-routes/explore?location=37.808960%2C-122.262498%2C11.00

library(tidyverse)
library(reactable)
library(reactablefmtr)
library(sf)

stations <- read_rds(here::here("data", "amtrak", "stations.rds"))
routes <- read_rds(here::here("data", "amtrak", "routes.rds")) %>% st_drop_geometry()

Routes

Route

  • Name (wiki link)

  • Logo?

  • Color

  • To/From

  • Distance (Hours)

  • Frequency (daily/weekly/etc)

  • Journey time

  • Types of cars

  • Map with Stations

  • Ridership 2012-2021

library(htmltools)

htmltools::tags$link(
  href = "https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Recursive:400,600,700&display=swap", 
  rel = "stylesheet")
amtrak_table <- 
  reactable(
    routes,
    searchable = TRUE,
    highlight = TRUE,
    wrap = FALSE,
    defaultPageSize = 43,
    columns = list(
      name = colDef(
        name = "Route",
        resizable = TRUE,
        cell = function(value, index) {
          tags$a(
            href = paste0('https://en.wikipedia.org/', routes[index, "url"]), 
            target = "_blank", 
            value)
        },
        minWidth = 200
      ),
      route = colDef(
        name = "Route",
        resizable = TRUE,
        html = TRUE,
        minWidth = 100
      ),
      daily_round_trips = colDef(
        name = "Daily Trips"
      ),
      fy2021passengers_1 = colDef(
        name = "Passengers (FY2021)",
        defaultSortOrder = "desc",
        format = colFormat(separators = TRUE),
        width = 120,
        class = "number"
      ),
      distance = colDef(
        name = "Distance (miles)"
      ),
      time = colDef(
        name = "Travel time"
      ),
      url = colDef(show = FALSE),
      type = colDef(show = FALSE),
      numbers = colDef(show = FALSE),
      route_miles = colDef(show = FALSE),
      operation = colDef(show = FALSE),
      train_set = colDef(show = FALSE),
      cars = colDef(show = FALSE)
    )
  )

div(amtrak_table)
library(plotly)

amtrak_route_plot <- 
  amtrak_rout_sf %>% 
  mutate(
    PLOT = map(
      geometry,
      ~ggplotly(ggplot(data = .x) +
          geom_sf() +
          theme_void())
      )) %>% 
  st_drop_geometry()

reactable(amtrak_route_plot %>% 
            select(NAME), details = function(index) {
              amtrak_route_plot$PLOT[[index]]
            })

reactable(amtrak_route_plot %>% select(STATION), details = function(index) {
  htmltools::plotTag(amtrak_route_plot$PLOT[[index]], alt="plots")
})

reactable(
  amtrak_route_plot,
  columns = list(
    route = colDef(cell = function(PLOT){
      p <- ggplotly(PLOT, height = 100)
      return(p)
    })
  )
)

%>% 
  reactable()

amtrak_rout_sf %>% 
  ggplot() +
  geom_sf(color = "purple") +
  theme_void()

reactable(amtrak_rout_sf, columns = list(
  PLOT = colDef(cell = function(value){
    subRoute <- amtrak_rout_sf[amtrak_rout_sf$NAME==value,]
    p<-ggplotly(
      ggplot(subRoute, aes(color = NAME)) + geom_sf()+ theme_void(),
      height = 100
    )
    return(p)
  })
))

Stations

  • Icon

  • Name (wiki link)

  • Location (State)

  • Station Type

  • Connections

  • Established Year

  • Notes (seasonal, etc.)

  • Local map

  • Ridership 2012-2021

reactable(wiki_routes_df, details = function(index) {
  station_data <- wiki_stations_df %>% unnest(route)
  station_data <- station_data[station_data$route == wiki_routes_df$name[index], ]
  htmltools::div(style = "padding: 1rem",
    reactable(station_data, outlined = TRUE)
  )
})
search_icon <- function(fill = "none") {
    # Icon from https://boxicons.com
    svg <- sprintf('<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="24" height="24"><path fill="%s" d="M10 18c1.85 0 3.54-.64 4.9-1.69l4.4 4.4 1.4-1.42-4.39-4.4A8 8 0 102 10a8 8 0 008 8.01zm0-14a6 6 0 11-.01 12.01A6 6 0 0110 4z"/></svg>', fill)
    sprintf("url('data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%s')", URLencode(svg))
}

test <- browsable(tags$i(search_icon()))
